title: Deseret Relief Society Hall
text:
The Deseret Relief Society Hall, at 4365 S. 4000 W. in <a href="Deseret%2C%20Utah">Deseret, Utah</a>, was built in 1906. It was listed on the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> in 1995. It was built for use by the relief society of the Deseret Ward of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.
It is a modest building with some <a href="Victorian%20Eclectic%20architecture">Victorian Eclectic</a> style. It has an entrance porch with Queen Anne detailing in its spindled brackets and lathe-turned columns. The porch in the west-facing gable end facade, and there are <a href="cornice%20returns">cornice returns</a> in the gable conveying Classical style.
It served as a religious structure, as a school, as a meeting hall, and as a clinic.
It is located on <a href="Utah%20State%20Route%20257">Utah State Route 257</a>, the main north–south road running through Deseret.
